com.ibm.watson.dsm.platform.topology.physical.star

Class StarTopologyMonitor

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ibm.watson.dsm.platform.topology.physical.AbstractPhysicalTopologyMonitor
      • com.ibm.watson.dsm.platform.topology.physical.star.AbstractStarTopologyMonitor
        • com.ibm.watson.dsm.platform.topology.physical.star.StarTopologyMonitor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IDistributedApplicationRegistry, IPhysicalTopology, IPhysicalTopologyMonitor

    public class StarTopologyMonitor
extends AbstractStarTopologyMonitor
implements IPhysicalTopologyMonitor
    Implements a topology monitor that uses an IDistributedApplicationRegistry to provide neighbor and reachability information for this node. All nodes in the registry are assumed to be connected directly to this node. As such they are all reachable and all neighbors.
    Author:
    dawood

        public void stop()
          throws DSMException
        Description copied from interface: IDistributedApplicationRegistry
        Stop the registry. Any dynamic registrations that happen betweeen IDistributedApplicationRegistry.start() and IDistributedApplicationRegistry.stop() should be cleared from the registry so that the registry is effectively in its initialized stated.
        Specified by:

      • getReachablePeers

        public java.util.Set<IApplicationDescriptor> getReachablePeers(IApplicationDescriptor app,
                                                      int hops)
        Description copied from interface: IPhysicalTopology
        Get the list of peers that are reachable within the given number of hops.
        Specified by:
        getReachablePeers in interface IPhysicalTopology
        hops - the number of network links to traverse. 0 or larger, where 0 means peers on the same host (i.e. without a hop between NICs).
        Returns:
        never null, but perhaps empty. The returned set does not include the given descriptor.
